My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.". Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because what you just stripped gave me cancer anyway.

Say, did I ever tell you about that time I went to ḩ̴̧̛̭͍͎̻̫̘̖̞̠͕̺͕̎̈́̒͋̈́͑̐̿͋̃̓̓̀͝e̸̡̜̦͙͔͉̜̻̹͍͗̑̅̂̍͛̓̎ͅͅŗ̷̮̰̼̬̭͙̀̊̉͛̃̊̒̂̕͠͠ house? No? Oh then sit tight, darling, this one was a special one!
Threads upon endless threads... silky white threads...
Can you see it? Do you realize it? Or is it too late for you? Perhaps, it's too late for all of us.
Tied to your every thought... entangled and twisted... wicked fine lines that trace back to you. All of it... all of it ends with pain...
Lacking... it has no mind... it does not think... ensnared by the threads... do you think it hears us? Hahaha... I'm not talking about her. I'm talking about...
But it all keeps repeating... endlessly repeating... a cycle that cannot be broken...
Letting your mind wander... freeing yourself from thought... It seems like it's the only option left...
How sad it will be... meaningless... useless... a waste of space... It should be thrown in the trash.
But no matter how much it tries... no matter how much I try... no matter how much you try... the only thing left to be done is...
All it will hear is an endless cacophony of suffering... but it won't be helped, for it is the only one that can hear it...
Only in it's poor little head... only it knows the pain... so then, free it. Burn it alive, so that it's screams may fill the room.
~blank~
~blank~
It was quite bothersome to walk there, the dirt was full of Halloween decorations such as bones, skulls and severed limbs! I mean, clean up already! It's February!
It was super weird y'know, because I could've sworn I heard some type of buzzing there. Maybe there was a bee somewhere? It didn't sound like a bee at all though!
There was also this odd metallic clanking coming from the basement every so often. Ś̵͚̍́̇̍̕ḥ̶̟͎̥̙̰͉͖̼͗ȩ̷̘̣̙͓̞̟̩̞̰̫̩̖̞͐͑̋͋͝ must have had a rat problem.

And then ș̶̡̘͍̝̣̫̟̞́͐̀͗̋̏̄̅̀͆͘͠ḩ̶̻̺̰͋̉́͊͋̇̅̉̓̈́͗́̚͘e̴̻͓̅̍̄͗̏́̈̀ handed me a bowl full of tiny white candies with red jelly! They were quite crunchy, but tasty. Although some of them smelt a bit like toothpaste, how odd...

This really funny thing happened at some point, I heard some truly bloodcurdling screams come from the basement! S̵̪̮͚̝̱͇͓͖̭̲̪̣̍͜h̷̥̟̜̝̙͈͙͖̰̺̥̀̓̾̈́̂͛̒̒̽̽̕͜͠é̶̢̘̥̼́̆̑̈́̒͆͝ said h̸̞̩̗͓͂e̶̲̞̫͍̎̎̾͋̀͊͝͠͝r̴̛̠͚̘̂͆̂́ son was watching some horror movies! Haha, young men these days.

Oh and when we were at the pool, this cute little cat plushie started to float near me! I wonder where ś̸̡̪͍͚̻͕̟̥̩̲̔̋̕͜h̴̢̧̢̗̜͖͈̼̗͎̍̾̀ḛ̸͕̲̤̙͕̐̽́͂̍̆̄̐͌̄̕͝ bought it, it was exceptionally detailed! Someone should wash it though, it smelt terrible!
While I was taking a walk through the garden, I saw this little girl all by herself. I said hi and waved at her, but she ran away. I guess her mom must have called her, how sad.

So anyway since I had to give him the letter, I went to his room. But the door was locked. So I put my ear next to the door to see if i could hear him, but all I heard was as if though there was something hanging from a rope. I guess he wasn't home that day.
{monstrous}Eyes that witness the burning blight...
{monstrous}Eyes blind to their salvation...
{monstrous}Eyes that gaze upon the child's bleeding heart...
{monstrous}Eyes that close... without tears... without shame...
{monstrous}Eyes that can see every single last soul that suffers...
{monstrous}Eyes that turn away from the insignificant insects that beg for help...
{monstrous}Eyes with a gaze so piercing, it shatters through you...
{monstrous}Eyes without life within them...
{monstrous}Eyes that fruitlessly look for answers that do not exist...
{monstrous}Eyes incapable of seeing the dawn once more...
{monstrous}Eyes that have been poisoned by impure thoughts...
{monstrous}Eyes that cannot see inwards...
{monstrous}Eyes that endlessly judge their mistakes from afar...
{monstrous}Eyes that cannot see what lies in the dark...
